--- title: Simulation Toolkit For Scientific Discovery (ST4SD) --- import { CodeSyntax } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { NetworkServices } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { CarbonForIbmDotcom } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { Kubernetes } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; The Simulation Toolkit for Scientific Discovery (ST4SD) simplifies the development, execution and dissemination of **virtual experiments**.
A **virtual experiment** is an application workflow which measures one or more characteristics of one or more input systems. It is the computational analog of a lab experiment.
}> **ST4SD Core** enables writing virtual experiments that can run on your laptop, on HPC machines, or on cloud. [Get Started](/st4sd-core-getting-started) }> **ST4SD Cloud** provides secure, scalable and robust deployments of ST4SD on OpenShift clusters. [Get Started](/st4sd-cloud-getting-started) }> **ST4SD Registry** provides a UI for sharing and browsing virtual experiments. [Get Started](/st4sd-registry-getting-started) }> **ST4SD Services** allows scientists to run virtual experiments and query their data via Jupyter notebooks. It includes a high-performance metadata-store that enables memoization. [Get Started](/st4sd-services-getting-started)
## Try it yourself If you have `python3` with `virtualenv` installed execute the following code to install `st4sd-runtime-core` and run a toy-workflow on your laptop
python 3.7 to 3.10 tested
```bash virtualenv -p python3 $HOME/st4sd-runtime-test source $HOME/st4sd-runtime-test/bin/activate pip install "st4sd-runtime-core[develop]" ``` Then execute ```bash git clone https://github.com/st4sd/sum-numbers.git elaunch.py --nostamp -l40 sum-numbers ``` This will create a new virtualenv called `st4sd-runtime-test` at `$HOME/st4sd-runtime-test` and install `st4sd-runtime-core` into it. It will also clone a repository into a directory called `sum-numbers` in whatever directory you run the above commands in. It will then run a toy-workflow that takes a couple of minutes to run. The toy workflow output will be in a directory called `sum-numbers.instance` To learn more see [**ST4SD Core**](/st4sd-core-getting-started).
